H0.text: Melatonin is the hormone secreted by the pineal gland that controls sleep‑wake cycles and several other processes.

H1.text: Testosterone is the hormone secreted by the pineal gland that controls sleep‑wake cycles and several other processes.

H2.text: T3 is the hormone secreted by the pineal gland that controls sleep‑wake cycles and several other processes.

H3.text: Estrogen is the hormone secreted by the pineal gland that controls sleep‑wake cycles and several other processes.

A4.text: Melatonin is produced in darkness by the pineal gland, a small endocrine gland located in the center of the brain but outside the blood–brain barrier.

A5.text: Melatonin plays a crucial role in regulating the sleep-wake cycle, also known as the circadian rhythm, in vertebrates.
